Lunarpine was relieved to hear Shadow Wings voice, she was still 
functional, she sounded alot better than when he'd heard from her 
last. She was at least partly healed, (I think healing that fast 
might be modeing)

"I'm fine Wing, just fly a low path to the Ark, I'll follow your 
scent. theres no sense in you getting blown to bits out here on my 
account."Lunarpine was a proud bot who knew his limitations, he 
wasn't about to accept help until he'd reached those limits. Internal 
systems were already starting to compensate, rerouting his scanning 
systems to his sense of smell.

"If you wanna help then just point me in the direction of the nearest 
functional Predicon, that one learned the hard way not to frag with a 
wolf."

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She emerged from the chamber fully healed.  She felt her strength 
had 
> returned to her.  She ran out of the Ark and looked to see that 
> Lunarpine was still alive.  She called out to him, "Lunarpine, You 
> alright?" She flew to his side and transformed into bot mode.  She 
> could see that his optics were damaged.  She grabbed his hand and 
put 
> it on her shoulder,"I'll be your seeing eye owl." She drew her 
dagger 
> with her good hand and threw it at Ares.
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > Lunarpine falls back in an immense amount of pain, he'd stopped 
> Ares 
> > from doing more harm, unfortunately the cost was 92% of his 
optical 
> > scanners. he no longer could see any details around him. just 
> shapes 
> > and blurs of movement.his olfactory sensors were still 
functioning 
> > though after that last shot he yook he didn't know for how long, 
> > Lunarpine transformed to wolf mode and used his sense of smell to 
> > head toward the ark. he was prepared to attack anything that got 
> > between him and the ark. he just hoped that it wasn't Maximal.
> > 
> > "Lunarpine to maximals I've taken heavy damage and need some 
cover 
> > fire. if you're close identify yourself, I don't want to avoid 
any 
> > friendly fire situations if I can." Lunarpines warning could be 
> heard 
> > from both sides. he just hoped the enemy was to bust with the 
other 
> > Maximals to bother him. Ares scent didn't seem to be following 
him. 
> > This wolf hoped that the ram was as damagedas he was if not more.
> > 
> > It was a good thing he'd stayed here for a short time, he could 
> smell 
> > his way around to make do.
> >
